clinical_study.official_title: Change in Corneal Endothelium After Glaucoma Surgery; Trabeculectomy and Glaucoma Implant Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this trial is to study the change in corneal endothelial cell after glaucoma surgery, non-contact specular microscopic examination is performed for the patients who underwent glaucoma surgery; trabeculectomy and Ahmed glaucoma valve implant surgery prospectively. Change in corneal endothelial cell density, hexagonality, and coefficient of variation of cell area will be analyzed and compared to the baseline and between the types of the surgeries.

detailed_description.textblock: To study the change in corneal endothelial cell after glaucoma surgery, non-contact specular microscopic examination is performed for the patients who underwent glaucoma surgery; trabeculectomy and Ahmed glaucoma valve implant surgery prospectively. Specular microscopy using non-contact type specular microscope (Noncon Robo SP-8000, Konan Medical Inc., Tokyo, Japan) was performed by one experienced examiner before surgery and 1, 6, 12, 18, and 24 months after surgery. All examinations were done at the center, superior, superonasal, and superotemporal area of the cornea, while the patient maintain fixation at the target in the equipment. The follow-up was stopped if serious complication requiring surgical treatment was developed or additional intraocular pressure lowering surgery is needed, and the data before the second surgery were collected.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in corneal endothelial cell density, hexagonality, and coefficient of variation of cell area

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical factors associated with the damage of corneal endothelium after glaucoma surgery

arm_group.description: Eyes with glaucoma and on anti-glaucoma medication but without glaucoma surgery
Eyes underwent Ahmed glaucoma valve implantation
Eyes underwent conventional trabeculectomy with mitomycin-C

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent glaucoma surgery; trabeculectomy and Ahmed glaucoma valve implant surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who need glaucoma surgery for intraocular pressure control
Exclusion Criteria:
- congenital glaucoma
- Pre-existing corneal abnormality
- lost from follow up without any ocular problem within 6 months from surgery
